title: Bug 6009 - New class wizard doesn't get context right for nested classes
description: When using the new class wizard in Build 20011106, the context for nested classes is not set correctly. The field for 'Enclosing Type' is blank, instead of defaulting to the current type in the editor.
OB: When using the new class wizard in Build 20011106, the 'Enclosing Type' field is blank.
EB: The 'Enclosing Type' field should default to the current type in the editor.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Open a .java file in the editor. 2. Click the new class button. 3. Check the 'Enclosing Type' field in the wizard.
